column5: Well first off i would like to thank everyone who responded to my first post about my new motor. I started my treck about 4 weeks ago looking for some more power for my boat i really wanted to go with a 4 stroke but i wasen't sure about the prices so i started calling dealers to see how much i was up against. Not much finding used at the dealers this time of year so i started checking Kajji smart shopper and Craigs list. Low and behold i found the exact motor that was rated for my boat back in 1989 150 HP Blackmax and she was a sweet motor too But it was a 1991 oil injected 2 stroke. The person selling it ended up being Chris Kontos an ex NHL hockey player what a great guy!! He took me out for a water test and the motor ran great so i I gave him a deposit for the motor. He needed 1 more week with the motor due to the fact he had company so i said no problem and made a date in a week to pick up the motor. Here is pic..... Next off was the day i was picking up the motor so i gave chris a call , he said he had a problem the motor he got was a long shaft but he needed a XL shaft so he asked me if i wanted the motor i told him i couldent afford it he said he would take a loss on it and only charged me 700.00 more then he was chrging me for the black max so i told him sure and drove back to Pennitang to pick it . My New Motor is a 2002 115 Murcury EFI Four Stroke and man does she FLY Here is a Pic I took it out on the water for the maiden voyage yesterday after getting the Jack plate and prop set up and it does a cool 51 MPH which is great for what im looking for. Here are a couple before and after shots with the two different motors BIG difference if you ask me .Also i am selling the 70hp Evinrude for a reduced price to OFC'rs for 1400.00 Power trim and tilt and controls Cheers BMM http://s198.photobucket.com/albums/aa311/mkilroe/?action=view¤t=DSC01414.jpg" target="_blank">http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa311/mkilroe/DSC01414.jpg" border="0" alt="Photobucket">
Sounds like a great deal Mike!
Nice going Mike! Hope you have some good days on the water with the new motor

Right on mike !!!!!  the new motor with fuel injection will fly man !!!...make sure every once in a while you run a bottle of injection cleaner through her as she is no different that the injectors on your car they need cleaning !!,you should notice a big difference in your fuel costs too,i bet the new motor will be better than that old evenrude you had for sure...cheers bud,it was nice meeting you that day at ernies shop...

That motor looks to be almost a perfect fit for that boat.  4 stroke is a nice option as well.  Vey nice. I teach Chris' son at school.  Look for this kid to make it to the nhl as well.  Big kid. Very coordinated and strong.  Dad has a good head on his shoulders and the kid does well in school.
Nice set up.  You deffinately came out ahead with this deal.  For the extra money in this motor, you'll save in gas compared to the Black Max.
very nice looking ride, and new motor!
VEry nice Mike, but I gotta tell ya, I'm a little hurt that you were in my neigborhood and ya didn't even call  Enjoy the new motor!  Maureen

Hello and thanks to all who replied. Sorry Maureen for not giving you a call the only problem is I dont have your Number (Snap)    Hey Bill dont forget to give me a call somtime befor the end of the season and oh ya i still need to download that ipod of yours Cheers BMM
